sect1.para: A project has no point if it doesn't have goals. Thankfully, the NetBSD Project has enough goals to keep it busy for quite some time. Generally speaking, the NetBSD Project:

listitem.simpara: provides a well designed, stable, and fast BSD system,
provides a portable system, which runs on many hardware platforms,

simpara.ulink: conforms to open systems standards as much as is practical.

sect1.para: Some more technical ideas about where we would like to take NetBSD over the next N years are described in our roadmap.
In summary: The NetBSD Project provides a freely available and redistributable system that professionals, hobbyists, and researchers can use in whatever manner they wish.

People often ask for a list of differences between NetBSD and other freely available unix systems. It would not be appropriate to try to explain the goals and philosophy behind other projects here - we suggest you check each site for their goals, and make your own decision.
